name: [C] Currency and Trade Legislation
description: This law holds Federal Regulations for currency management and other financial, trade and land ownership topics.

properties.Title: Automated Seigniorage Transferal
properties.UserDescription:
Whenever the Federal Bank mints new Euro, four percent of the minted sum are taken as seigniorage into the Treasury of the Federal Government.
The Director of the Federal Bank can freely adjust the minting seigniorage between 0% and 10% by contacting the Game Masters to change the amount inside this law. 4% is merely the default value. Euros can only be minted if the Federal Bank holds less than 50% of the currency in circulation

RightNumber.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="MintCurrency">New Currency Created</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="MintCurrency">New Currency Created</ecoicon>: The amount of new currency was created.

properties.Title: Restriction of Financial Items
properties.UserDescription: Mints, Treasuries and Banks may only be placed by the Director of the Federal Bank on the property of the Federal Bank

properties.Title: Minting Restrictions
properties.UserDescription: Only the Director of the Federal Bank may mint currencies.

properties.Title: Setting Official Trade Currencies
properties.UserDescription: The Euro is the official trading currency. Only the Federal Bank, the Federal Government and the States may additionally trade with Stores offering "Donation Receipts" (and are required to do so in most cases).1 Donation Receipt means you donated goods to a government institution that would have cost them 1€ to acquire.By default, no state facilities are added to the list of permitted districts as their location is not set beforehand and no district for them exists.To get their state facility added, the Governor can propose a district marking the Donation Receipt Store and then contact the GMs who will fastpass the district and add it to this list so the State can offer Donation Receipts too.
